main_definition: Placement or condition of being in the middle, balanced, or focused.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having a central position physically or metaphorically.
meanings_and_examples.example: The dancers were perfectly centered on the stage during their performance.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Focused attention and awareness of oneself in the present moment.
meanings_and_examples.example: After meditation, she felt more centered and at peace with herself.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having one's life or priorities aligned and balanced.
meanings_and_examples.example: He tried to center his life around what truly mattered to him after the breakup.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Being at the heart of a situation, often with authority or control.
meanings_and_examples.example: The mayor was completely centered in all discussions regarding city planning.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having an equal balance between two contrasting elements.
meanings_and_examples.example: The graphic design had balanced colors and centered text for visual appeal.
